intro: Phippsia airoides, commonly known as the orchid orchid, is a species of flowering plant in the Orchidaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy orchid-like flowers that are typically yellow or green with red or purple markings. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
